intro: Aphyllon californicum subsp. grayanum, commonly known as the grayleaf aphyllon, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its reduced foliage, with leaves that are often small, grayish, and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Asteraceae family.
